form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: Screeneded by NARA, 8/7/2023, RESPONSE TO FORM I-72

full_text: Screened by NARA, 8/7/2023 Blalock and Gray A Partnership in Law 11726 San Vicente Blvd., #650 Los Angeles, California 90049 Humberto R. Gray Telephone: (310) 447-5665 Fax: (310) 820-7143 March 13, 1996 IMMIGRATION & NATURALIZATION SERVICE 300 NORTH LOS ANGELES STREET LOS ANGELES CALIFORNIA 90012 ATTENTION: OFFICER MC KENNEY officer Mckania (NOT A CONTINUED CASE) RE: RESPONSE TO FORM 1-72 NOT A commend ALIEN: JAGAT SINGH CASE FILE#: A72 937 061 Dear Mr. Mc Kenney: If you recall this case, in agreement with you and Mr. Weidensohler, you indicated that the documents could be submitted directly to you and not to the continued cases. The reason that the Beneficiary is ninety-two (92) years of age and the Petitioner is sixty (60) years old. Both were born in former Pakistanian territory which is now India. The issue was which documents could be submitted to prove the relationship of the Petitioner/Beneficiary. Mr. Weidensohler that school leaving certificates of the Petitioner, which indicates and specifies the relationship would be sufficient. We have enclosed two school leaving certificates for the Petitioner as well as the following additional information: 1. School leaving certificate from Punjab University; 2. School leaving certificate from Punjab University Matriculation Examination; 3. Notification of recent announcement of death of the spouse of the beneficiary who would of also received permanent resident status with the beneficiary; 4. Copy of passport of Petitioner verifying a relationship; and 5. Record of Military Service of Petitioner verifying relationship between (sre notes infle)
